meanings.definition: A plural noun meaning a divine power or spirit believed to inhabit natural objects or phenomena.

meanings.sent2: The indigenous tribe performed rituals to honor the numina of the mountains.
meanings.sent3: During the storm, the children imagined the numina of thunder and lightning having a dance party.
meanings.sent4: The numina of the forest whispered secrets to those who listened closely.
meanings.sent5: The numina of the ocean roared with power and mystery, captivating all who beheld it.

meanings.definition: A singular noun meaning a divine presence or spirit.
meanings.sent1: The hermit claimed to have encountered a numina in the form of a glowing orb.

meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to have a numina companion guiding their actions.

meanings.sent5: The numina of love enveloped them in a warm embrace, dispelling all fear and doubt.
